授業目的:
Cross-cultural studies: focus on Japan and Canada

特記事項:
この授業を履修するには、事前にレベル認定の申請が必要です。詳細は備考欄を確認してください。

本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
In principle, this course will be conducted face-to-face. For students who are required to take the course remotely (i.e. online), all class materials, tasks, and explanations will be posted in a Google Classroom dedicated to this class. For those who need to take classes online, a synchronous Zoom class will be held at the same time as the F2F class.

Depending on the number of students who enroll in this course, the format may include the following:
- Individual, pair, and group discussion based on topics that relate to content
- Presentation and journal assignments
- All components of the course to be conducted in English
- Being an MS class, English tasks are expected to be performed at an advanced level

第1回:
**The following is a schedule of what the course MIGHT look like. Exact contents will depend on student interests and needs, as determined by the needs analysis completed during the first class.**

Week 1: Class overview, introduction, and ice breakers

All 14 sessions are conducted face to face
Needs Analysis Questionnaire: 1 hour
第2回:
Homework each week will involve a journal submission of at least 300 words that will involve topics to be discussed in the following class.
Journal 1: 1-2 hours
第3回: Week 3: connecting character, society, and culture: a focus on Japan
第6回: Week 6: stereotypes, prejudice, discrimination, and racism
第7回: Week 7: Geert Hofstede six dimensions of culture - final project introduction
第8回: Week 8: conducting interviews for research and managing expectations
第10回: Week 10: regional differences (e.g. domestic, Canada vs. USA, Japan vs. Korea), and reflecting on the assimilation of intercultural competences
第11回: Week 11: pop culture and culture shock
